body: Looks like it's caused by clicking the element detaching itself so parentNode is not present anymore. ðŸ¤”

issue.title: Type error when click preloaded url link 1.0.0-next.565 / 567
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I have a few links preloaded, but when I click con them, goes to the URL but browser console shows me an error:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2943127/204389446-c13fce78-8429-490a-9713-ef89756efb78.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2943127/204389502-2ddb1e78-bec7-4fca-b6e0-f5a9fb4db41e.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2943127/204389656-5e463033-2e87-4b30-80a5-94171d2c5489.png)



### Reproduction

```svelte
<script>
  import { preloadData } from '$app/navigation';
</script>

      <li
        ......
        on:click={() => {
          if (button.url) {
            goto(button.url);
          } 
        }}
        on:mouseenter={() => {
          if (button.url) preloadData(button.url);
        }}
      >
```

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: Linux 3.10 CentOS Linux 7 (Core)
    CPU: (4) x64 Intel Xeon Processor (Skylake, IBRS)
    Memory: 1.52 GB / 15.51 GB
    Container: Yes
    Shell: 4.2.46 - /bin/bash
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.15.0 - /usr/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - /usr/bin/yarn
    npm: 8.19.2 - /usr/bin/npm
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-node: ^1.0.0-next.99 => 1.0.0-next.101 
    @sveltejs/kit: ^1.0.0-next.565 => 1.0.0-next.565 
    svelte: ^3.52.0 => 3.53.1 
    vite: ^3.2.3 => 3.2.4
```


### Severity

annoyance

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: Adding support for standalone expressions (no contract)

repository.name: rain-studio
repository.description: Rain Studio is the ultimate platform for creating smart contracts and blockchain-based applications using Rainlang.

issue.body:
This PR adds support for creating and displaying an expression with no attached contract.

Later, we could add support for adding a contract and expression type after creation.

issue.title: ignore elements that are no longer in the document
issue.body:
closes #7876. This is an alternative to #7879 â€” the issue is that the click handler doesn't run until after Svelte has updated the DOM, meaning in some cases the element no longer exists in the DOM. In those cases it probably makes sense to bail altogether.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. All changesets should be `patch` until SvelteKit 1.0

issue.title: `find_anchor` doesn't handle removed elements correctly / is called erroneously after an element is removed
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Using `on:click` to remove an element or a (grand- etc)parent of that element results in `find_anchor` (defined in `packages/kit/src/runtime/client/utils.js`) being called with the element that is now not element of the DOM anymore, which in turn results in `element` becoming `null` while iterating up the hierarchy, which `find_anchor` does not handle.

### Reproduction

```svelte
<script>
    let list = ["X"];
</script>

{#each list as elem}
    <button on:click={() => { list = []; }}>{elem}</button>
{/each}
```
or as a repository (based on `npm create svelte@latest`, I hope that is minimal enough?): https://github.com/42triangles/repro-remove-elem-error


### Logs

```Shell
InstallTrigger is deprecated and will be removed in the future. utils.ts:8:12
[vite] connecting... client.ts:19:8
[vite] connected. client.ts:134:14
Uncaught TypeError: element is null
    find_anchor http://localhost:5173/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/utils.js?v=d082ee91:118
    _start_router http://localhost:5173/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/client.js?v=d082ee91:1447
    addEventListener eval:4
    _start_router http://localhost:5173/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/client.js?v=d082ee91:1440
    start http://localhost:5173/@fs/home/dodo/repro-remove-elem-error/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/start.js:43
    async* http://localhost:5173/:19
utils.js:118:7
```


### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: Linux 6.0 Arch Linux
    CPU: (12) x64 AMD Ryzen 5 3600 6-Core Processor
    Memory: 21.65 GB / 31.28 GB
    Container: Yes
    Shell: 5.9 - /usr/bin/zsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 19.2.0 - /usr/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - /usr/bin/yarn
    npm: 8.19.2 - /usr/bin/npm
  Browsers:
    Firefox: 107.0.1
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.90 
    @sveltejs/kit: next => 1.0.0-next.567 
    svelte: ^3.53.1 => 3.53.1 
    vite: ^3.2.4 => 3.2.4
```


### Severity

annoyance

### Additional Information

It looks like this doesn't result in any actual visible bugs beyond the error being shown in the console, though if `find_anchor` being called in this context is correct, the fix would be very simple too.

issue.title: link_option: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'getAttribute')
issue.body: ### Describe the bug When I try to toggle anchors I get this error: ``` utils.js?v=cd9e9890:50 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'getAttribute') at link_option (:5173/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/utils.js?v=cd9e9890:50:11) at get_router_options (:5173/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/utils.js?v=cd9e9890:157:45) at HTMLDivElement. (:5173/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/client.js?v=cd9e9890:1466:21) ``` Happens on `1.0.0-next.570` Most likely related to https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/7876 `` is the only affected element that I found. ### Reproduction ```svelte {#if visible} remove {:else} add {/if} ``` https://github.com/mc-0bit/sk-getAttribute ### Logs ```Shell utils.js?v=cd9e9890:50 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'getAttribute') at link_option (:5173/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/utils.js?v=cd9e9890:50:11) at get_router_options (:5173/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/utils.js?v=cd9e9890:157:45) at HTMLDivElement. (:5173/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/client/client.js?v=cd9e9890:1466:21) ``` ### System Info ```Shell System: OS: Linux 6.0 Arch Linux CPU: (16) x64 AMD Ryzen 7 5800X 8-Core Processor Memory: 21.92 GB / 31.29 GB Container: Yes Shell: 5.1.16 - /bin/bash Binaries: Node: 18.12.1 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.12.1/bin/node Yarn: 1.22.19 - /usr/bin/yarn npm: 8.19.2 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.12.1/bin/npm Browsers: Brave Browser: 107.1.45.133 Firefox: 107.0.1 npmPackages: @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.90 @sveltejs/kit: ^1.0.0-next.570 => 1.0.0-next.570 svelte: ^3.53.1 => 3.53.1 vite: ^3.2.4 => 3.2.4 ``` ### Severity blocking an upgrade ### Additional Information _No response_
